Reviews.Title: “Some problems but customer service is good”
Reviews.Author: teaearlgreyhot
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel all things considered. Ideally located next to the Metro, but food options are not as comprehensive. Customer service is warm and helpful *by Parisian standards*. On my first night I did not have a room available so they reaccomodated me into another hotel. Not very nice, unfortunately but was upgraded to the Superior room for the remainder of my stay. There are a couple of niggles, apparently the air conditioner stops working when one opens the window and then never worked again for the rest of my stay. The hotel did not replenish my free minibar and then charged me when I asked for a refill. And the shower in my room does this weird thing where it's intensely hot for 5 seconds and then warm for a good 30 seconds and then crazily hot again for 5. All in all, very all over the map, but probably the best hotel I've stayed in in Paris for the price in a while to be very honest.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Too average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the front desk help were very helpful for Parisian standards and the breakfast was good for the price, the hotel itself wasn't what I expected from Accord at this price range. Definnitely lookig for better options on my next trip to Paris maybe in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paulista05
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel. Located in front of Voltaire subway, this hotel looks new one, maybe recently refurbish. Room is small, but reasonable for a couple. Free (and good) internet wi-fi. The hotel has lift, enough one to carry at least 4 lugagges. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel in a Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Marion053 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and extremely comfortable. We stayed in a superior room, which was huge for Paris standards. I assume that the standard size room would have been more than adequate. The value was excellent, although we did get a good deal from booking through the internet. I am not sure what the normal rate would be. Overall, an extremely clean and very well appointed hotel, and I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bigamee
Reviews.Content: For me this hotel ticked all the boxes for a city break in Paris: great location - walkable to many places of interest, right next to the Metro for the others with easy links to Gare du Nord for the train; small and boutiquey so it didn't feel inpersonal; excellent staff - well trained and very service focussed (rarely found outside the very best hotels in Paris); recently refurbished so nothing looks worn out or tired; reasonably sized rooms and bathrooms, extremely well furnished and to a high standard. So exactly what I would hope to (but rarely do) find - all at a reasonable price. Any issues - only that the breakfast is euro 16 if you take it in the hotel so, if you think that is high, then visit one of the many local cafes (or even Macdonalds just up the street) to find something for less)

Reviews.Title: “Review for Mercure Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renovated recently as you can see it is quite new. However, the room is quite small that we do not really think it's worth of 145 EURO for a day. Although it is near the metro, it is not near any attraction. Also, the room is so dim.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms with open bathroom and drainage smell for ridiculous 240EUR++”
Reviews.Author: Roadtoholidays
Reviews.Content: Hotel in pretty good location, but extremely small rooms where just the bed fits in and nothing else. Free wifi but complicated to use as it requires new login every 20mins. The bathroom has swing doors and drainage smell covers the room. To counter this, the hotel applies a lot of perfume which gives the whole room a stuffy feeling. The only way is to cover the drain and air a lot. For all this you are charged 240EUR++ excl breakfast. This is a joke. Overall I don't recommend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Value deal on travelocity but hidden charges and double charged us on our pre-paid stay”
Reviews.Author: Jrucb
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel thru travelocity package for hotel and airfare. I didn't know much about Paris but seemed like it was near some sites like the Notre Dame and other site seeing destinations. Not knowing anything about the subways, buses and not having any Euros on us after a redeye flight, we got off at the Chatelet Les Halles stop after taking the train from the airport. And boy, it was quite a long walk from there to the hotel. We checked with Ernesto, from the hotel staff, who was very friendly and initially helpful except for one minor but important error. When I asked if the breakfast was complimentary, his answer was "yes, complimentary breakfast". This came back to haunt us on check out. The hotel was very clean, modern with a recent renovation we read about on Tripadvisor. The room was a bit small but within the norm for Europe. Quiet stay with minimal street noise. Breakfast served each morning was delicious with good service, but expensive (16 euro/ person) and NOT complimentary. Our main gripe with the hotel is that they charged us for the stay even though it was pre-paid thru travelocity. Hopefully just an error. But I won't be staying at a mercure in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel - a bit random”
Reviews.Author: AxelR0695
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been refurbished in Mercure style, modern-looking plastic furniture. I got there at 23.30 and had the surprise to wake a woman up as I opened the door. She got so scared she screamed and got me scared too. Anyway, went back to the front desk to be given another room and got given a twin. Called the front desk, explained I had paid for a double bed. After going back to the front desk, I finally made it to my double bed room, extremely small, but at least, unoccupied. The receptionist did apologise 'as he was new to his role'. The wireless did not work properly and I had no desk to sit at, just some sort of small table from which I could work on sat on the bed, in a rather uncomfortable position. The bathroom was clean. Overall, I thought it wasn't very good but the service was helpful but inexperienced/rather clumsy. I'd go there again for business and if I have to, but would go somewhere else if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: LePPrince
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 3 days, and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is really nice and modern! The rooms are ok sized, and not too small. Good sized bathrooms too. Also the rooms have air-conditioning so the temperatures are comfortable. The breakfast was a little expensive I think, but except from that it was great. The staff was often very busy and we had to wait to talk with them because they were in the phone all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrGustavo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel!! They should improve the air conditioner!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiOh
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Stayed there for 5 nights, had 2 rooms booked (1 single, 1 double). The hotel is quiet and clean and I thought it is nicely decorated. The rooms were spacious enough and very clean with a modern decor, beds were comfy and bathroom was also very clean with a great shower. There are no closets in the rooms, which didn't bother me personally but my parents would have preferred not to have lived out of their suitcases. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet has a great choice. Breakfast staff was also very friendly. The Voltaire metro station is just a few steps from the hotel and there are a number of restaurants, cafes and bars around. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel - we will return”
Reviews.Author: sian02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May with our 3 year old. Great size room which accomodated extra child bed. Bathroom the biggest I have seen in Paris. Breakfast was fab and we took advantage of having it in our room one morning. Not as much choice as going to the breakfast room but plenty. Location is excellent being very close to the metro and staff were very helpful. Don't really want to tell everyone about the hotel because we don't want it to become so popular that we can't get a room next time! But felt I really must leave a review as it is so deserved and the earlier reviews relate to the hotel before it was refurbished and may give a false impression. I cannot recommend highly enough to anyone who wants a great hotel in fairly central location. Not the cheapest but definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “a new clean and efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: alessandroVI
Reviews.Content: we spent in paris few days, and we stayed at the hotel three nighst. The hotel is a new building. Everything was ok. The room was not so big but well organized. Watchout cause the hotel is in rue Richard Le Noir, not in Blvard R L N. We had lost and we went at Blverd first. We was very afraid we there was no hotel. Rue is near Bulevard. The voltaire metro stop is best one, few meters from the entrance of the hotel.
